intro: Rhacoma coriacea, commonly known as the rough rhacoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Rhacoma coriacea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique foliage and showy blooms.
